SEARCH

Class BookList

java.lang.Object
BookList
public class BookList extends Object
The BookList class represents a circular linked list of Book objects and provides methods for adding, deleting, and manipulating the list.

  • Method Details

    • addToStart

      public void addToStart(Book b)
      The function addToStart adds a new node containing a book to the beginning of a circular linked list.
      Parameters:
      b - The parameter "b" is of type Book, which represents an object of the Book class.

    • storeRecordsByYear

      public void storeRecordsByYear(int yr)

    • insertBefore

      public boolean insertBefore(long isbn, Book b)
      The function inserts a new book node before a specified book with a given ISBN in a circular linked list.
      Parameters:
      isbn - The ISBN (International Standard Book Number) of the book that you want to insert before.
      b - The parameter "b" is of type Book, which represents a book object.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value. It returns true if the insertion is successful and false if it is not.

    • insertBetween

      public boolean insertBetween(long isbn1, long isbn2, Book b)
      The function inserts a new book node between two existing book nodes in a circular linked list based on their ISBN numbers.
      Parameters:
      isbn1 - The ISBN of the book that should come before the new book (b) in the linked list.
      isbn2 - The parameter "isbn2" is the ISBN number of the book that comes after the book we want to insert.
      b - The parameter "b" is an object of type Book.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value. It returns true if the book was successfully inserted between the two given ISBNs, and false otherwise.

    • displayContent

      public void displayContent() throws NoAuthorFoundException
      Throws:
      NoAuthorFoundException

    • delConsecutiveRepeatedRecords

      public boolean delConsecutiveRepeatedRecords()
      The function `delConsecutiveRepeatedRecords` checks for consecutive repeated records in a circular linked list and removes them if found.
      Returns:
      The method returns a boolean value indicating whether any consecutive repeated records were deleted from the circular linked list.

    • extractAuthList

      public BookList extractAuthList(String author)
      The function `extractAuthList` extracts all books from a circular linked list that belong to a specified author and returns them in a new `BookList` object.
      Parameters:
      author - The `author` parameter is a `String` that represents the name of the author.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a BookList object called `extractedList`.

    • swap

      public boolean swap(long isbn1, long isbn2)
      The function swaps the positions of two nodes in a circular linked list based on their ISBN values.
      Parameters:
      isbn1 - The ISBN of the first book that needs to be swapped.
      isbn2 - The parameter "isbn2" is the ISBN of the second book that needs to be swapped.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value.
